definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

sentences.english: If escaping from death, need equestrian desert, in the future good stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 大难不死的话，就需要骑马逃跑，日后好东山再起。

sentences.english: Those who have survived realize the meaning of life .
sentences.chinese: 那些劫后余生大难不死的人，认识到了生命的意义。

sentences.english: a cat's ability to survive falls is based on fact.
sentences.chinese: 猫在跌落时能够大难不死是有事实作依据的。

sentences.english: The boy, who was unscathed by his ordeal, left the mall with his father.
sentences.chinese: 这名大难不死的男孩儿随后同他的爸爸离开了商场。

sentences.english: To realize the value of one second:Ask a person who has survived an accident.
sentences.chinese: 要想知道一秒钟的价值，那就去问大难不死的人。

sentences.english: Two other workers attempted to kill themselves by jumping off buildings but survived.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有两名工人跳楼自杀，但大难不死。

sentences.english: You are lucky to be alive after the accident.
He always seems to land on his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎总是能大难不死。

sentences.english: Sometimes there is survival of people in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 空难事件中有的人大难不死。

definition: mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
